It was moved and seconded that Schooley, Miller and tfynn be appointed a
committee of three, with Schooley as chairman, to draft the above purpoces and
functions Into a formal statement to be submitted to the Board for examination and
consequent action and approval. The motion was carried.
In a further discussion of NAEB relationships with the JCET, NCCET, and Center
it was proposed that the JCET should serve as a national representative for educa¬
tional television interests at the government and association levels, while the NAEB
should serve as a national representative for the educational broadcasting stations
(radio and TV) at the institutional and administrative levels. The NCCET should
serve as a national representative for educational television interests at the
community, state and regional agency and organisation levels, while the NAEB should
serve as a national representative for the comaunity, state and regional stations
and networks at the operational and administrative levels. The Educational Radio
and Television Center should serve as a national program planning, development
and distribution center, while the NAEB should serve as the program production and
broadcast network for the Center through its member stations.
It was proposed that the NAEB and the Center cooperate through a committee
arrangement as follows:
